title: Service and reliability
text: I use this company whenever possible, I travel mainly to Europe and have always found the prices very good the service both reliable and helpful.I recommend this company to my fellow travelers

title: Very good
text: I always use Easyjet when I can. I find their prices very reasonable, the staff most polite an helpful. The main problem I have is the the information systems in the smaller airports I cannot make out what they are saying as they speak so quickly in what ever language so I end up following the crowd!! I know I am getting on in years but I have spoken to other passengers younger than myself and they have the same problem.That I am happy to say is my only complaint.I always recommend Easyjet to other travellers .

title: Acropolis
text: I recently spent 6 days in lovely Athens, the main reason I went was to visit the Acropolis and I was not disappointed We arrived at night and when I went on the veranda and right in front of me on a hill was the illuminated Acropolis it took my breath away, I was determined to visit the sight although I am frightened of heights!It was marvellous the viewing was well organized with everybody able to examine the Temples without a crush.I thoroughly recommend a visit.

title: A long awaited trip
text: Our trip was excellent, long awaited as I find ancient Greece fascinating and going there I saw all the places I have read about and was not disappointed.

title: Wonderful Athens
text: My friend and I rented an apartment through Home and Away booking agency The apartment was attached to the Acropolis Ami Boutique Hotel. The apartment was well furnished and clean the staff very helpful, and as advertised it looked over the Acropolis. We found the city of Athens was all we had hoped for. Pleasure open top buses were frequent going to all of the interesting sites and you could hop and of the buses as the ticket lasts for 24 hours The restaurants were reasonable priced and plenty of them.One thing I should mention is Athens has many steep hills so good sensible shoes essential !!! Our holiday experience was great and would recommend our city visit.

title: Journey on a Steam train
text: I took my granddaughters on a trip from Tenterden to Bodian on the steam locomotive I had not been on one for at least 50yrs and it was well worth the wait. Whilst on the train we were given information of the surrounding beautiful countryside, it was very interesting historically. We arrived at Bodian Castle with enough time to walk around the ruins and have a drink. We then caught the train back. My Granddaughter thoroughly enjoyed the experience and a good time was had bt all.

title: Comfortable and friendly "pub"
text: This is a proper village pub the staff are friendly and very helpful.Dogs are allowed on the premises.I have had dinners there which have been very good .I have also attended groupmeetings there as they have a very good room for such occasionsThe Dec or is exactly in character with village.

title: Though wary of heights I was glad I overcsme my fear and went to the uppermot platform
text: The view from the Mill is quite beautiful well worth a visit but check for opening times as the mill only opens on particular days.The mil is operational when I paid a visit and you could purchase freshly ground flour

title: This is a small museum that is most interesting.On display are various items showing the progress of the local area
text: I found this very interesting and would advise visitors I've it a visit this small but interesting museum.Before they go would advise them to check opening times

title: Excellent
text: Chris and Karen Ward make you welcome as soon as you arrive. The facilities are excellent and breakfast was fresh and covered all tastes. I would thoroughly recommend this B&B.We did not know the area so our hostess recommended various trips which we followed through with great success.
